text: To mortals \add belong\add* the plans of the heart,
but from Yahweh \add comes\add* the answer of the tongue.
All the ways of a man \add are\add* pure in his own eyes,
but Yahweh weighs the spirit.\f + \fr 16:2 \ft Or “breath” \f*
Commit your work to Yahweh,
and your plans will be established.
All Yahweh has made \add is\add* for his\f + \fr 16:4 \ft Or “its” \f* purpose,
and even the wicked for the day of trouble.
An abomination of Yahweh \add are\add* all who are arrogant of heart;\f + \fr 16:5 \ft Or “mind” \f*
⸤rest assured⸥,\f + \fr 16:5 \ft Literally “hand to hand” \f* he will not go unpunished.
By loyalty and faithfulness, iniquity will be covered over,\f + \fr 16:6 \ft Or “atoned for” \f*
and by fear of Yahweh ⸤one turns⸥\f + \fr 16:6 \ft Literally “turning” \f* from evil.
When the ways of a man are pleasing \add to\add* Yahweh,
even his enemies he will cause to make peace with him.
Better is little with righteousness
than great income with no justice.
The ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 16:9 \ft Literally “heart” \f* of a person will plan his ways,
and Yahweh will direct his steps.
A decision is upon the lips of a king;
in judgment his mouth will not sin.
A balance and scales of justice \add belong\add* to Yahweh;
all the weights of the bag \add are\add* his work.
An abomination to kings \add is\add* doing evil,
for by righteousness the throne will be established.
The delight of kings \add are\add* the lips of righteousness,
and he who speaks what is upright he will love.
The wrath of a king \add is\add* a messenger of death,
but one who is wise will appease\f + \fr 16:14 \ft Or “atone, cover over” \f* it.
In the light of the face of the king \add there is\add* life,
and his favor \add is\add* like a cloud of spring rain.
Getting wisdom: ⸤how much⸥\f + \fr 16:16 \ft Literally “what” \f* better than gold!
And getting understanding: it is chosen ⸤over⸥\f + \fr 16:16 \ft Literally “from” \f* silver.
The highway of the upright, it turns from evil,
he who guards himself\f + \fr 16:17 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* keeps his way.
Before destruction \add comes\add* pride,
and before a fall, a haughty spirit.\f + \fr 16:18 \ft Hebrew “a haughty of spirit” \f*
Better a lowly spirit with the poor
than dividing the spoil with the proud.
He who is attentive to a matter will find goodness,
and he who trusts in Yahweh, his own happiness.
The wise of heart\f + \fr 16:21 \ft Or “mind” \f* is called perceptive,
but he who is pleasant of lips will increase persuasiveness.
A fountain of life is wisdom for its owner,\f + \fr 16:22 \ft Or “master” \f*
but the instruction\f + \fr 16:22 \ft Or “punishment” \f* of fools is folly.
The heart\f + \fr 16:23 \ft Or “mind” \f* of the wise will make his mouth judicious,
and upon his lips, it\f + \fr 16:23 \ft Or “he” \f* will add persuasiveness.
Pleasant sayings \add are\add* a honeycomb,
sweetness to the soul and healing to the bones.
There is a way \add that seems\add* upright ⸤to⸥\f + \fr 16:25 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* a man,
but its end \add is\add* the way of death.
The life\f + \fr 16:26 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* of a worker works for him,
for his ⸤hunger⸥\f + \fr 16:26 \ft Literally “mouth” \f* urges him.
A man of wickedness concocts evil,
and his lips \add are\add* like a scorching fire.
A person of perversity will spread dissent,
and he who whispers separates a close friend.
A person of violence will entice his neighbor
and cause him to walk on a way \add that is\add* not good.
He who winks his eyes \add does so in order\add* to plan perverse things;
he who purses his lips will bring evil to pass.
A crown of glory is gray hair;
by a righteous life it is gained.
He who is slow to anger\f + \fr 16:32 \ft Literally “nostrils” \f* \add is\add* better than him who is mighty,
and he who controls his spirit than him who captures a city.
The lot will be cast into the lap,
but all of its decisions are from Yahweh.
